description.narrative: By 2020, strengthened legal framework and justice services adequately respond to children in contact or in conflict with the law, which contributes to Access To Justice, Access To Justice (Covid), Birth Registration, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Private Sector Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the poorest and most marginalised children benefit from a more effective child and social protection system (cash and care)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, strengthened legal framework and justice services adequately respond to children in contact or in conflict with the law

description.narrative: By end 2019, as a result of UNICEF's Mozambique financial and technical contribution, 80 per cent of registration offices and sites in Mozambique are using the new electronic Civil Registration System (eCRVS) and have moved away from a paper based to a digitized birth and death registration system. This major system shift was achieved through the deployment of IT solutions, rehabilitation of civil registration offices, legislative adjustments, training and demand generation. In 2019, National Directorate of Registry and Notary (DNRN) registered 316,593 number of children (133,954 under 1 year, 131,042 under 5 years and 51,597 above 5 years). | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of sites with functioning eCRVS in target provinces
Health workers trained on Birth registration
Existence of free and universal birth registration service within the civil registration in accordance with national legal requirements

baseline.value: free in first 120 days as per Civil Registration Code

target.value: 2020:free under 1 year as per reviewed Civil Registration Code
